text: This will always remind me of when I left high school.  I went to a different kind of high school for nerdy kids and there was such a strong sense of solidarity among the students that an injury to one was an injury to all.  I learned so much about the world and myself in that short time, I would listen to this on my CD walkman and daydream about what tomorrow could bring.
author: Ack

text:
Why is there a number in the title? I see a "232". What's the 232 stand for? I don't get it.
Simple name the video "Best VGM: Chrono Trigger - To Far Away Times".
Then you got the title right!

It's my favorite game ever.

author: Southern Cross

text:
I will play this when I turn 18. 
It's what I'll listen to when I graduate.
This is what everybody will cry to as my future husband and I exchange vows.
And I'll have my pregnant belly listen to it, everyday until they're born.

It's incredible how a mere sequence of chords can contain the beauty and meaning of everything, how so easily it can arise infinity. This is the greatest game of all time
author: Giulia Ferrucci

text: I love it when games and art can bring me to tears, it's one of the primary things I look for in good art. This part of the game made me cry harder than I've ever cried playing a game. Truely a masterpiece!

text: I think I ruined myself on RPG's. This game happened to be the very first RPG I've ever played, and I just had to play right off the bat the very best one ever made. Every one since then has been (relatively speaking) a downhill slide. Not to say there haven't been other worthy RPG's as well (FFVI and Mother 3 come to mind) but man, this one just knocks the competition outta the park.

author: Don Raggo

text: When I first achieved the specific ending that features this track (Chrono and Marle with the balloons, the one "true" ending as far as I'm concerned) I couldn't help but cry. I was a 17 year-old devirginized  male so I had to turn in my masculinity card but yep, the beautiful song - and the beautiful ending - came together in such a way that it was hard not to feel overwhelmed. The ending was so simple, so touchingly sweet, that I really got hit with the feels. Watching the scene and hearing the music gave me a bittersweet mix of joy for what I'd experienced, hope for what the future may bring, and loss at knowing that such a grand adventure had come to an end. The most perfect ending to one of the most perfect video games ever made.

author: Peewee Deedee

text: It's sad to see such a beauty like this game be hidden by it's obscurity. It's always on "best game ever" lists, but it's not as well spoken as Ocarina or FFVII, so no one new plays it, even though Chrono Trigger is probably better than those two. It just goes to show how the quality of a game doesn't matter, what does matter is how popular it is and how well it sells. I hope to god Square Enix does remake this game, or at the very least they should port it to the PS4. So many people will be happy, and so many people will be introduced to this masterpiece of game design.

author: hi

text: Really? Hm, I hadn't expected that. :)

There were several ports.

First: PS1 port, pretty much just SNES version with some fmv and horrible loading times.

Second: DS port, 2 new side quests on the end added + fmv from PS1 version, has no loading times, probably best version.

Third: Android/iOS version: Horrible DRM (Just get the pirate version for android if you must), controls are... could be better, it does have the 2 new side quests, but no fmv.

text: It really shows, too. It's absolutely fantastic. There isn't one thing that I do not like about any of the tracks from the game.

text: Chrono has the best music period
author: VGSoundFX

text: the current top comments really deserve all the love :)
author: Katara1337

text: This song is a... validation. There is a sense of finality to the tone, and you KNOW that the journey is done. It's bittersweet, and you have to let a lot of things dear to you go, but you can now rest. It's truly over. I love this. This is how ending songs should go, and should be the measure for all ending songs. When I die, I want this to be playing as I close my eyes. :)
author: Geallach83

text: oh man, i remember beating this game with my big bro... ;_;
author: Saria Kokiri

text: this is a happy place.
author: seriousbees

text: One of the finest song in the history of video game music. I can still remember hearing this for the first time. So much memories...
author: Lugosi2006

text: He worked himself sick on this soundtrack, and he did a truly incredible job.
author: Jackalope

text: It was certainly something to play the game when it first came out. I got the game the day it was released in North America (August 22, 1995) when I was 11. I played it with my friends non-stop through the Thanksgiving and Christmas holidays that year. They are some of the best memories of my life.
author: HibanaSp3

text: It's alright! live and learn as i say! i learned im quite possibly the worst dancer on the face of the earth and i know little about how to make the girl i like happy. however we're dating now so everything is all good! and even if it the night wasnt super amazing it was still something special for me! (btw thanks for the concern!)
author: BombOmbBuddy

text: yea mine was pretty fun. i went with a pretty hot girl but she was my friend so i was comfortable and got to enjoy it without being nervous ya dig? plus after prom parties were awesome. sorry to hear yours wasnt as good :/
author: Thomas Dooploop

text: Dont mean to pry into your personal life but how did prom go for ya? mine was kinda bad so i hhope your went better! :D
author: BombOmbBuddy

text: listening to this today as i get ready for my senior prom. its crazy to think i first heard this song when i was 7 and now 11 years later its the theme song of one of the greatest nights of my life. it seems fitting for the day too.
author: Thomas Dooploop

text: Songs like this, and pretty much everything else about this game, is the reason why this game will most likely sit as my personal all time best game for the rest of my life.  No other game can invoke such emotion, whether it be sadness, horror (the scene with Luca's mom) wonderment, joy or humor from such modest sprites.  Everyone who worked on this game were magicians, and show why this industry should be considered and a viable storytelling medium.

author: Zryuken

text:
I often think we (the ones that played this masterpiece during the 16 bit days) have been blessed.The SNES was thoroughly squeezed in the graphics and sound department in a way I never expected.Every piece of music in this game is aural magic....no other way to describe it.

Sure,you can download and play it now.But taking that cartridge to the slot,turning it on and being graced by that tick of the clock...just thinking about brings tears to my eyes.

We had it good,boys :*)

author: drseussisdeaddd

text:
Best VGM 71 - DKC 2 - Stickerbush Symphony: 790,312 views
Yup, great song.
Best VGM 30 - FF6 - Terra: 611,129 views
Not as much mass appeal, I guess.
Best VGM 34 - SM64 - Dire Dire Docks: 406,847 views
Really?  SM64 was huge.  I guess it's just too mellow for most people.
Best VGM 232 - CT - To Far Away Times: 105,714 views
... wut?

Best VGM 4 - FFX - Silence Before The Storm: 281,371 views
à² _à² 

I'm going to blame this on the upload order, because this is the best VGM ever, period.

text:
I remember seeing this game in Nintendo Power, (the cover had the Virtual Boy on it.) and I remember reading for almost a whole hour just being amazed; then I went to the kitchen and showed my mom and said, "I want this game!" She later rented it for me and I couldn't wait till Christmas day of 1995. When I finally got it, I knew it would be my favorite game of all time. No game has affected me like this one has.

Simply put, one of the greatest games of all time!!

text: @crazypikachulol Back in the day, brand new games, especially huge games like Chrono Trigger were craaazy marked up. Especially considering I got it the day it came out. I still think it was totally worth it. It is literally the best near $100 I've spent to this day. I'm 23 now, and I've purchased a lot of things, including a car, computer, and a ton of other things. Chrono Trigger was the best money I've ever spent, by far.

author: Bard Main

text: Too all you kids saying you wish you could have been born in the time when CT was released... You were! It was on the DS, and although not a perfect port, it was great. I enjoyed it very much, and even though the exclusive content was nothing more than fetch quests, I dug it very much. You may not have been born in a time when this game was FIRST released, but SquareEnix was kind enough to re-release it to allow you youngsters the opportunity to experience just what we did in 95.

author: Botcatcher

text:
I remember the very first time I played this game... The day it was released in the US. I picked it up for a hefty $85. I still have the ticket from the Toys R Us I picked it up at. 1995. I was 8 years old at the time. I played it through in about a week. Between school, homework and other things a kid does, I was engrossed into it's story... I couldn't believe a game like this existed.

Nearly 15 years later, nothing has changed. This game is, and always will be, the greatest game ever created.
author: Chris Handsome

text: Oh Chrono you handsome lady flirter. You didn't say a word yet you where the hero we all wanted.
author: Ecchi-BANZAII!!!

text: I agree.  First played the game on March 8, 1996 - my 14th birthday.  I'll never forget its epic tale, not even two days before I die.
author: ComradeSephiroth

text: Epic.
author: Fingolfin3423

text:
Sadly, it NEVER received the praise it was due back upon its original release. But its cult following has grown ever since and has been heralded as one of the best games ever made, even by rivals who have made countless attempts to mimic it. Memorable characters, a gripping story, epic music, multiple endings, and all backed by a dream team of artists, composers, and designers.

Chrono Trigger, nothing like it before...or since.
author: Windclaw

text:
AND YET....
The world changed for the better...at least for now.
The End.

text: Amazing game, amazing soundtrack, and an amazing ending song.  It really fits the tune of the game perfectly and gives a great feeling of overcoming all of the negative and the eminent end of the world for a happy ending. text:
I don't have words to describe this masterpiece, i remember when i completed chrono trigger, dude i cried hearing to this, i want to hear this when i acend to heaven.
For a videogame to have this feeling and make me cry, i have to give this the best game ever in my opinion, this is a legendary game, not just a rpg.
author: Daniel Aldama

text:
This should should be mandatory at every happy event (weddings, in particular). I'm a guy who's main musical niche is 90s rock, and I when I listen to this, I can't find adequate words to describe how I feel, yet I can when listening to my favorite Pearl Jam songs. 

Don't you hate how video game music isn't recognized by most people as "real" music? I bet one spin of this would change their mind.

text: Actually, RD had a different sequel, one less known about, and sadly, part of it involved Lynx having a giant mecha... But CC was in fact supposed to be a remake/alternate timeline of RD. Gil in RD became Guile in CC, there's a log entry from RD in Chronopolis from studying alternate timelines... Among other things, heh.

text: It doesn't need a sequel. Sometimes you shouldn't make another game in a series just because the first was good. Chrono cross was, in my opinion, a disappointment, even though the battle system was superb. I want it as much as any man, but Original IP is far better than sequels.

author: distr0ia

text: This theme is so perfect. A group of friends who may never see each other again, one of whom may not even exist any more, going on one last awesome ride through time together. This track encompasses the sheer enjoyment they can get from time travel now they've finished the mission, while also keeping a touch of melancholy. Expertly done.
author: Babybahamut

text: Yeah, this one is great.  I also like the Robo theme.
author: Knightmare2k6

text:
I read in an interview that Mitsuda used to sleep in the studio some nights, while composing for Trigger. Musing alone with his instruments all through the night, amidst (occasional) rest, he came up with many of his pieces. He said that during these times, song ideas sometimes came to him in dreams. 

One of the most memorable pieces he recalled first conceiving in his dreams was... guess.
author: SunkenCathedral

text: My favourite song from Chrono Trigger and probably my favourite ending theme ever. Rivaled only by the ending theme from (surprise surprise) Chrono Cross.
